newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Bank of Korea intervenes to ease won's fall.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Korea intervenes to ease won's fall.

text.p: The central bank of Korea intervened in the interbank market in Wednesday morning trading to slow the won's fall against the dollar, dealers said.
The central bank denied the intervention as it always does.
Traders said the central bank intervened when the won hit a low of 820 to the dollar and the local currency was pushed back up to an intraday high of 818.50 won.
"It's a sign that the central bank doesn't want the dollar to rise above 820," said a local trader. "That level will play as a resistance for a while."
Prior to the intervention, the won had been falling pressured by short dollar covering and import settlements.
